page.title: 03NEW ABBEY - EDUCATION
page.content: New Abbey school is a fairly new open-plan rural school. It was opened in May 1975 and replaced the old granite building which had served the needs of the community for over a hundred years. Between 1975 and 1981 the pupil roll dropped from 67 to 42 and teaching staff was reduced from three to two. Now, however, the roll has gradually increased and there are again three full-time teachers. The school is also served by a remedial specialist twice weekly and specialist teachers in art, music and physical education once a week. During the past year the older children have been offered tuition in swimming, sailing and orienteering. All round New Abbey children's educational and recreational needs seem to be well catered for.
